sentences.en: Everything was wrong, his life seemed to be a wasteland.
sentences.cn: 每件事都不对劲，他的生活百无聊赖。

sentences.en: He went back to his hometown and opened up wasteland for cultivation.
He went to his hometown and opened up wasteland for cultivation.
Large tracts of wasteland have become a granary.
Less than a decade ago, Beijing city was an industrial wasteland.
sentences.cn: 不到十年前, 北京市还是一片工业荒原.

sentences.en: More wasteland will be opened up here.
sentences.cn: 这里将开垦更多的荒地.

sentences.en: Our story begins with a caravan heading through the wasteland of Durotar.
sentences.cn: 我们的故事从穿越杜隆塔尔荒地的车队开始.

sentences.en: The area around Sweristal reminds one of a barren wasteland.
sentences.cn: 瑟韦斯托周围的地区使人感觉仿佛来到了不毛之地.

sentences.en: The farmers are trying to bring the wasteland under cultivation.
sentences.cn: 这些农民正在努力把这片荒地变为良田.

sentences.en: The pollution has already turned vast areas into a wasteland.
sentences.cn: 污染已经使大片地区沦为不毛之地。

sentences.en: The seventies were a cultural wasteland.
The wasteland was transferred into fertile fields.
They decided to start opening up the wasteland tomorrow.
sentences.cn: 他们决定明天开始开垦那块荒地.

sentences.en: They opened up large areas of wasteland and turned them into farmland.
sentences.cn: 他们在荒原上拓出大片农田.

sentences.en: They opened up large tracts of wasteland.
We shall turn this piece of wasteland into wheat fields.
sentences.cn: 我们要把这块不毛之地改成麦田.

words.tran_cn: [农]荒地，不毛之地；未开垦地，荒漠；（精神或文化上的）贫乏

trans.tran_en: an unattractive area, often with old ruined buildings, factories etc on it
